Shaman (a Siberian term): In many ‘primitive’ societies a man (or woman) endowed with exceptional insight who communicates with spirits in the beyond. 21 This myth is preserved in a summarizing comment on Odyssey 11, the Nekuia; the scholion can be traced back to the mythographer Pherekydes (c. 540 bce). See also Apollodoros Bibliotheca I, ix, 12. Iphiklos was a hero from Thessaly and an Argonaut, and Melampous a diviner and doctor from Pylos, who was informed by a vulture of how to cure Iphiklos’ sterility
